oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Huey landing at Vung Chua Mountain

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A Huey helicopter lands on a pad at Vung Chua Mountain, throwing up a great quantity of dust. Fences, buildings, and communication equipment can be seen in the background. Note: a non-color-corrected master TIFF copy is also available.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Helicopters; Military personnel; Soldiers; Mountains

Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam; Qui Nhon (Vietnam); Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-; Military helicopters -- United States -- History; Vietnam War, 1961-1975 -- Aerial operations, American; UH-1 (Helicopter)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The UH-1 (or as it was originally designated the HU-1) "Huey" is one of the most recognizable and widely used helicopters in the world. During the Vietnam conflict, Huey's were used for many purposes including MedEvac, command and control, air assault, personnel and material transport, etc. It has several distinctive characteristics such as a rounded nose, a twin-bladed rotor, and the loud "whomp-whomp" sound the helicopter makes in flight. Approximately 7,000 UH-1 aircraft saw service in Vietnam.
